org.fluidity.foundation

Class Lists

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fluidity.foundation.Utility
      • org.fluidity.foundation.Lists

  • public class Lists
extends Utility
    Utilities related to arrays.

    Usage Example

     final String[] array = Lists.asArray(String.class, Arrays.asList(items.split("\\s*,\\s*")));

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • notNull

        public static <T> T[] notNull(Class<T> type,
                              T[] array)
        Returns either the array parameter or, if it is null, an empty array with the given component type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the component type of the array.
        Parameters:
        type - the component type of the array.
        array - the array.
        Returns:
        either the array parameter or, if it is null, an empty array with the given component type.

      • concatenate

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> T[] concatenate(Class<T> type,
                                               T[]... arrays)
        Concatenates the given list of arrays.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the component type of the arrays.
        Parameters:
        type - the component type of the arrays; any item may be null.
        arrays - the array list.
        Returns:
        a new array containing the values from all non-null arrays.

      • asArray

        public static <T> T[] asArray(Class<? super T> type,
                              Collection<T> list)
        Complements Arrays.asList(Object[]) with a conversion to the opposite direction. This is a convenience method that calls Collection.toArray(Object[]) on the received list with the list's sized array and, in most cases, does all the unchecked type casts needed for the operation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the component type of the given list and the returned array.
        Parameters:
        type - the item type of the list/array; may not be null.
        list - the list to convert to an array; may be null.
        Returns:
        an array containing the elements of the given list; never null.

      • asArray

        public static <T> T[] asArray(Class<? super T> type,
                              boolean array,
                              Collection<T> list)
        Complements Arrays.asList(Object[]) with a conversion to the opposite direction. This is a convenience method that calls Collection.toArray(Object[]) on the received list with the list's sized array and, in most cases, does all the unchecked type casts needed for the operation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the component type of the given list and the returned array.
        Parameters:
        type - the item type of the list/array; may not be null.
        array - tells whether a null or empty list should be returned as an empty array (true) or null (false).
        list - is the list to convert to an array; may be null.
        Returns:
        an array containing the elements of the given list; may be null if empty is false.
